definition: a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: Most beginning bows come with the bowstring so we won't get into bowstrings.
sentences.chinese: 大多入門級弓帶弓弦所以這裏我們不涉及弓弦。

sentences.english: Most beginning bows come with the bowstring so we won't get into bowstrings.
sentences.chinese: 大多入門級弓帶弓弦所以這裏我們不涉及弓弦。

sentences.english: Geng Ying positioned himself, drew back his empty bowstring and feigned the shot of his arrow.
sentences.chinese: 更羸擺好姿勢，拉開弓弦，虛射一箭。

sentences.english: The first thing to be done was to bend the bow in order to attch the string.
sentences.chinese: 要做第一件事就是彎弓，裝上弓弦。

sentences.english: Eventually, the back tension release will release the rope loop and the bowstring.
sentences.chinese: 最終，背加力撒放器會釋放D環以及弓弦。

sentences.english: Life is a bow , bowstring is the dream.
sentences.chinese: 生命是一張弓，那弓弦是夢想。

sentences.english: The utility model provides a ukulele, which is the improvement of the national bowed stringed instruments.
sentences.chinese: 四絃琴是一種經過改革的民族弓弦樂器。

sentences.english: Geng Lei releases it suddenly. The wild goose falls stiffly on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 更羸突然鬆開弓弦，大雁直挺挺地摔了下來。

sentences.english: Life is a bow, the bowstring is a dream.
sentences.chinese: 生命是一張弓，那弓弦是夢想。

sentences.english: The first thing to be done was to bend the bow in order to attach the string.
sentences.chinese: 第一件要做的事就是彎弓以裝上弓弦。

definition: a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
to bend the body at the waist/to bow
to wind/to tighten/crescent moon/first quarter or waxing moon
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
